body_html:
I ran into this yesterday also. It wasn't obvious to me what to do, but someone, maybe on stack overflow, pointed out that you can select (for example cuda 9.2) on the pytorch installation page, and it then it generates the correct command to run. I tried the command below, after uninstalling the previously installed pytorch, torchvision and cuda toolkit, and it fixed this same problem for me.
conda install pytorch torchvision cuda92 -c pytorch

body:
I ran into this yesterday also.  It wasn't obvious to me what to do, but someone, maybe on stack overflow, pointed out that you can select (for example cuda 9.2) on the pytorch installation page, and it then it generates the correct command to run.  I tried the command below, after uninstalling the previously installed pytorch, torchvision and cuda toolkit, and it fixed this same problem for me.
conda install pytorch torchvision cuda92 -c pytorch
